Text: Gain 3$. You may discard a card in hand. If you do, any ally draws a card.

Text: Gain 2$. If this is the second time you have played Diamond Cluster this turn, gain an additional 2$.#Rule clarification: You may not gain the bonus $ more than once per turn.
Flavour text: These gems were once the most precious, the most scarce. Now they line the walls of caves like shimmering fangs.

Text: Gain 2$.
Flavour text: Jade is as common as bone at the mouth of the cave.

Text: Gain 2$. Gain an additional 1$ that can only be used to gain a spell.
Flavour text: "Some use these to heat and light their hovels against the dark of the cave. Others know that within these gems lies a fire that can be tamed." - Ghan, Gem Scavenger

Text: Gain 2$. Each player reveals the top card of their deck and either discards it or returns it to the top of their deck.
Flavour text: "To those who have stepped through the breach, the pearl shows the splinters of time itself." - Phaedraxa, Breach Mage Seer

Special: When you gain this, you may place it on top of your deck.

Flavour text: "Once, the trees of V'riswood towered ancient and beautiful. These polished bits of their amber is all that remains beyond that memory." - Brama, Breach Mage Elder

Text: You may cast a prepped spell that you prepped this turn. If you do, that spell deals 2 additional damage.
Flavour text: While appearing to be crudely fashioned, these staffs contain within them the very essence of the void.

Text: Destroy this. Destroy up to two cards in your hand or discard pile. Draw a card.

Text: The next time you focus or open a breach this turn, it costs 3$.#OR#Destroy this. Deal 1 damage.

Text: Focus any player's breach.#OR#Destroy this. Gravehold gains 3 life.

Text: Gain 1 charge. Any ally gains 1 charge.

Text: Play a gem in hand twice and destroy it.#OR#Gain 2$.
Flavour text: "Not every pretty rock is a means to wage war. Some must be cut and carved into more useful things." - Adelheim, Breach Mage Weaponsmith

Special: While prepped, once per turn during your main phase you may return a gem you played this turn to your hand.

Text: Cast: Deal 3 damage. Deal 2 additional damage for each prepped spell in an adjacent breach.

Text: Cast: Destroy up to two cards in hand. Deal 3 damage for each card destroyed in this way.

Text: Cast: Discard up to two cards in hand. Deal 3 damage for each card discarded this way.
Flavour text: "Xaxos always says, to come back to light, we must first visit the shadow." - Malastar, Breach Mage Mentor

Text: Cast: Deal 3 damage. You may discard a card in hand. If you do, any player gains 1 life.

Special: This spell may be prepped to a closed breach without focusing it.

Text: Cast: Deal 2 damage. Any ally gains 1 charge.

Special: While prepped, at the end of your casting phase, deal 1 damage.

Special: While prepped, once per turn during your main phase, you may gain 1$.
Text: Cast: Deal 2 damage. You may discard a gem. If you do, deal additional damage equal to its cost.
Flavour text: Many folk have made their fortune harvesting gems. The very breaches through which The Nameless come bestow the stones with strange properties.

Text: Cast: Deal 2 damage. You may lose 1 charge to deal 2 additional damage.#Rule clarification: You may not lose more than one charge to deal further additional damage.
Flavour text: "In The World That Was, there were great birds, born of fire and ash. They were thought to be immortal, and yet none now remain." - Malastar, Breach Mage Mentor

Text: Cast: Deal 2 damage. You may destroy a card in hand.

Special: When you gain this, gain 1 charge.

Text: Gain 1 charge. You may destroy a card in hand or on top of any player's discard pile.

Text: Cast any player's prepped spell without discarding it.
Flavour text: "Breach mages are never truly in possession of their own minds." - Brama, Breach Mage Elder

Special: When you gain this, you may place it on top of any player's discard pile.

Text: Gain 2$. You may place a card in hand on top of your deck. If you do, gain an additional 2$.

Text: Destroy a card in hand. You may gain a card from any supply pile that costs up to 3$ more than the destroyed card.

Text: Suffer 1 damage. Any player draws two cards.#OR#Destroy this. Any player gains 2 life and 1 charge.

Text: Gain 2$. You may discard a prepped spell. If you do, gain an additional 1$.

Text: Gain 2$. Gain an additional 2$ if there is at least one nemesis turn order card in the turn order discard pile.

Text: Gain 2$. You may place the next card you gain this turn on top of your deck.

Text: Gain 2$. If the nemesis tier is 2 or higher, gain an additional 1$.

Cast: Deal 1 damage. Allies may collectively discard up to two cards in hand. For each card discarded this way, deal 3 additional damage.

Text: Cast: Deal 4 damage. If this damage causes a minion from the nemesis deck to be discarded, any ally gains 2 charges.

Text: Gain 2$.
Flavour text: The ancients prized this gem for its potential.

Text: Gain 2$. If you have two or more prepped spells, gain an additional 1$.
Flavour text: One vein of pure radite can power a mage for life.

Text: Gain 3$.
Flavour text: Marble is among the most valued materials in Gravehold.

Text: Focus any player's breach. Any player may prep a spell in hand.
Flavour text: Connecting to another mind requires precision and exacting concentration.

Text: Any ally draws two cards.
Flavour text: A helping hand can turn the tide of a battle.

Text: Cast: Deal 2 damage.
Flavour text: This basic spell is standard in every mage's repertoire.

Text: Cast: Deal 2 damage. If you have two or more other prepped spells, deal 1 additiona damage.

Text: Cast: Deal 3 damage.
Flavour text: This spell is the standard for those who want to fight up close and personal.

Text: Cast: Any player discards a card in hand. If they do, deal 4 damage.
Flavour text: Normally, breach mages do not experiment with gravity. These are not normal times.

Text: Gain 2$. You may discard a gem in hand. If you do, gain an additional 2$.
Flavour text: Long ago, Brama discovered that this compound could temporarily drain and transform another gem's essence into raw aether.

Text: Gain 1$. You may destroy a gem in hand.
Flavour text: This strange creature was discovered by Mist and has become her pet. She calls it "Chompy".

Text: Cast: Deal 2 damage. Focus any player's III breach.

Text: Cast: Deal 2 damage. If this spell was cast from an opened III breach, deal 3 additional damage.

Text: Gain 2$. If you have 3 or more charges, gain an additional 1$.

Text: Cast: Deal 4 damage. You may discard a spell in hand. If you do, deal 1 additional damage and gain 1 charge.
Flavour text: Every mage knows the legends of the stars' power, but little remains besides this spell.

Text: Cast: Deal 3 damage. If you have 3 or more charges, gain 1 charge.
Flavour text: Learned mages can compound their stored charges, leading to even greater power.

Text: Gain 1 charge. Any ally focuses their closed breach with the lowest focus cost.
Flavour text: Discovered in the ancient tunnels, this knife can slice through reality in a way never before seen.

Text: Gain 2$.#OR#!Silence a minion.

Text: Focus any player's breach. Two different players may destroy the top card of their discard pile.

Special: While prepped, once per turn during your main phase, you may place a relic you played this turn or a relic in your discard pile on top of your deck.
Text: Cast: Deal 4 damage.
Flavour text: Malastar has developed a way to recharge relics quickly, allowing them to be used more often.

Special: When you gain this, you may place it on top of any player's discard pile.
Text: Cast: Deal 5 damage. Gravehold gains 1 life.
Flavour text: When two breaches touch, memories and thoughts collide, often with unexpected results.

Text: Gain 2$. If your III breach is opened, gain an additional 1$.
Flavour text: When broken down, Portalite allows a seasoned breach mage to draw even greater aether from a particular breach.

Text: Gain 2$. Any ally draws a card.

Text: Gain 2 charges. !Silence a minion.

Special: When you prep this, deal 1 damage.

Text: Gain 2$. Gain 1 pulse token.#OR#You may lose 1 pulse token. If you do, gain 3$.

Text: Any player gains 3 pulse tokens. That player may lose 1 pulse token. If they do, they destroy a card in hand.

Text: Any ally gains 1 charge. Any player gains 2 pulse tokens. You may lose 2 pulse tokens. If you do, cast any player's prepped spell. That spell deals 1 additional damage.

Special: While prepped, once per turn during your main phase, you may gain 1 pulse token.

Text: Gain 1$. Gain 2 pulse tokens. Until the end of the turn, you may lose 1 pulse token to gain 1$ any number of times.

Text: Gain 1 charge. Reveal the top card of your deck. You may destroy it. If you don't, gain 1$.

Special: When you gain this, gain 2 pulse tokens.
Text: Cast: Deal 2 damage. You may lose 1 pulse token. If you do, any player gains 1 life.
Flavour text: This spring of Pulse energy is enough to refresh the most drained mage.

Text: Cast: Deal 6 damage. Gain 1 pulse token. You may lose any number of pulse tokens. If you do, any ally draws cards equal to the number of pulse tokens lost this way.

Text: Gain 2$. Gain 1 pulse token. You may lose any number of pulse tokens. Deal damage equal to the number of pulse tokens lost this way.
Flavour text: Strange pulses now run through our bodies. Perhaps they can be directed outwards and used to destabilize our foes.

Text: Gain 2 pulse tokens. You may lose 4 pulse tokens. If you do, open any player's closed breach. Then, gain a spell from any supply pile that costs 5$ or less and prep that spell to any player's opened breach.
Flavour text: Sometimes, all a mage needs is a little jump-start.

Text: Cast: Deal 4 damage. If there are three or more empty supply piles, deal 3 additional damage.
Flavour text: Not all magic is used to destroy. This spell, however, can do nothing but destroy.

Text: Cast: Deal 7 damage. Any ally may destroy a card in hand. If they do, they gain 2 life.
Flavour text: The sphere can temporarily invert a mage's power, allowing them to turn it in upon themselves to restore their wounds.

Text: Gain 2$. Gain 1 pulse token.#OR#Gain 2$. Lose 1 pulse token. If you do, gain 1 charge.
Flavour text: This gem allows mages to gain and convert latent Pulse energy into charges.

Text: Gain 3$. If there are seven or more cards in your discard pile, gain an additional 1$.
Flavour text: Efficient management of resources is key to a swift victory. The breach mage who plans ahead can turn a disadvantage into a great strength.

Special: When you gain this, !Silence a minion.
Text: Gain 3$.
Flavour text: This newly discovered gem innately allows its user to silence minions. Mist never told us where she found it.

Text: Gain 2$. If you have three or more cards in hand that cost 0$, gain an additional 2$.
Flavour text: The power of this resin ebbs and flows - when placed next to stronger materials, the power of the resin fades, hidden away inside.

Text: Gain 4$ that cannot be used to gain a card.

Text: Gain 2$.#OR#Gain a Summonite from the supply and place it on top of any ally's discard pile.
Flavour text: When imbued with the correct frequency of energies, the summonite is able to replicate itself, thus increasing its potential.

Text: Gain 3$ that can only be used to gain cards.
Flavour text: Triplite is a fragile crystal, holding unbalanced energies inside. A careful hand is required to use it properly.

Text: Gain 2$. Each ally may discard a card in hand. Each ally that does gains 1 charge.

Text: Gain 3 charges.
Flavour text: Now that we have access to the stars themselves, our ancient rites allow us to borrow their power, storing it up for a time of great crisis.

Text: Reveal the top card of your deck. You may destroy or discard it. Each ally may draw a card. Each ally that does discards a card in hand.

Text: Gain 1$. The next time you gain a card this turn, you may also gain a card that costs less than the gained card.
Flavour text: By bending the rules of space and time, this container allows a mage to conserve much of their aether.

Text: Gain 1 charge. If there are seven or more cards in your discard pile, gain 1 additional charge.
Flavour text: There are many secrets to be found in the dusty stacks of old tomes left behind on the surface by long-dead scholars.

Text: Any player gains 1 pulse token. Each player with 2 or more pulse tokens gains 1 charge.

Special: When you gain this, if there are seven or more other cards in your discard pile, gain 2 life.
Text: Cast: Deal 5 damage.
Flavour text: It is only after exhausting all other possibilities that the solution to your problems rises to the top, striking like a bolt of lightning.

Special: While prepped, during your casting phase, you may lose 2 pulse tokens. If you do, spells you cast this turn deal 1 additional damage.
Text: Cast: Deal 1 damage. Gain 1 pulse token.
